page.title: 13A Saxon church in Breamore 2
page.content: as can the monograms{IHS}and{ABM.} Three mass clocks remain, the one on the porch being minute. Seven double splayed Saxon windows remain, the actual apertures being in the middle thickness of the wall with splays at either side to maximise light while minimising the weakening of the wall. Succeeding centuries added other windows. The external face of the tower is probably original Saxon built of flint with{quorns}and{pilasters }of green sandstone and ironstone. The inside, however is much modified including the chancel and nave arches. There was a floor 15ft from the ground from which the bells were rung.This connected by a now blocked door to a rood over the nave. Both have vanished and the four bells (recast 1922) are now rung from the ground.
